title: Movement of charges - speed of electron

content.question: A small charged object of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> and positive charge <math alttext="positive lowercase q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>q</mi></math> is released from rest very far away from a negatively charged nonconducting sphere with uniformly distributed charge <math alttext="negative uppercase Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo><mi>Q</mi></math> that is held fixed. Which expression best represents the speed of the charged object when the object is a distance <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> from the center of the sphere?

choices.label: <math alttext="the square root of the fraction with numerator 2 lowercase k times lowercase q, times uppercase Q, and denominator m r squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>k</mi><mi>q</mi><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>m</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></msqrt></math>

<math alttext="the square root of the fraction with numerator 2 lowercase k times lowercase q, times uppercase Q, and denominator m r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>k</mi><mi>q</mi><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>r</mi></mrow></mfrac></msqrt></math>

<math alttext="the square root of the fraction with numerator 2 lowercase k, times uppercase Q, and denominator m r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>k</mi><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>r</mi></mrow></mfrac></msqrt></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the square root of the fraction with numerator 2 lowercase k, times uppercase Q, and denominator m r squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>k</mi><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>m</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></msqrt></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the square root of the fraction with numerator 2 lowercase k times lowercase q, times uppercase Q, and denominator m r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>k</mi><mi>q</mi><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>r</mi></mrow></mfrac></msqrt></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
